meanings.definition: On or in a vehicle, ship, or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The passengers are safely onboard the cruise ship.
meanings.sent2: Please wait until the plane is onboard before taking off.
meanings.sent3: The luggage was left onboard the bus, causing a delay.
meanings.sent4: The captain announced that all passengers must be onboard before departure.
meanings.sent5: The sailors gathered onboard the ship for a safety briefing.

meanings.definition: To include or involve someone or something as part of a group or project.
meanings.sent1: We need to onboard new employees for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent2: The team decided to onboard a new member to help with the workload.
meanings.sent3: The company onboarded a talented artist to design their new logo.
meanings.sent4: It is important to onboard all stakeholders for a successful collaboration.
meanings.sent5: The manager onboarded the interns with a detailed orientation session.

meanings.definition: To come on board a ship or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: Passengers will onboard the plane shortly for their flight.
meanings.sent2: The crew members need to onboard the ship before it sets sail.
meanings.sent3: The travelers rushed to onboard the train before it departed.
meanings.sent4: The pilot instructed everyone to onboard the helicopter quickly.
meanings.sent5: The passengers were excited to onboard the cruise ship for their vacation.
